greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: A(n,k) = Sum_{d|n} phi(d)*k^(n/d); square array A(n,k), n>=0, k>=0, read by antidiagonals.
comment: Dirichlet convolution of phi(n) and k^n. - _Richard L. Ollerton_, May 07 2021
link: Alois P. Heinz, Antidiagonals n = 0..140, flattened
formula: A(n,k) = Sum_{i=0..min(n,k)} C(k,i) * i! * A258170(n,i). - _Alois P. Heinz_, May 22 2015
G.f. for column k: Sum_{n>=1} phi(n)*k*x^n/(1-k*x^n) for k >= 0. - _Petros Hadjicostas_, Nov 06 2017
mathematica: a[_, 0] = a[0, _] = 0; a[n_, k_] := Sum[EulerPhi[d]*k^(n/d), {d, Divisors[n]}]; Table[a[n - k, k], {n, 0, 12}, {k, n, 0, -1}] // Flatten (* _Jean-François Alcover_, Dec 06 2013 *)
results.author: _Alois P. Heinz_, Aug 29 2013
